column4: I was wondering... When the next version of ubuntu comes out I'm going to reinstall rather that update. Do I loose all the configuration I've done previously if I do that?
can someone confirm this? do I loose every file if I reinstall?
I mean, every file in my ubuntu partition
if you reinstall over an existing install..yes you lose it all
hm, I see...
oh well, no other thing to do that upgrade then...
you need to back up to cd or external drive ...everything you want to save
are these files  or applications you want to save?
do you have dropbox installed? it has 2gigs of free storage and well worth the effort
yeah, quite a bit of work in there
does it exceed 2 gigs?
hmmm, I don't think so, but it takes a lot of time to upload things to the dropbox cloud
well not too much time considering that it will be safe and reinstalltion can be done without concern
and what about programs and other configs? I loose all those too?
for programs you can use aptoncd
that will essentially back up the applications that you are using at the moment and reinstall them later
I'll see that
both dropbox and aptoncd may be your saving grace ... this way you can reinstalll at any given time knowing that these things are safely backed up
I have an NTFS partition, so I guess I can backup all my important files there. aptoncd seems useful
thanks for the help
yes that is the other option for sure...I sometimes do that on the windows partition
